children.name: Food Research & Action Center
children.desc: FRAC is the leading national nonprofit organization working to eradicate poverty-related hunger and undernutrition in the United States.

children.name: International Food Policy Research Institute
children.desc: IFPRI has developed applications built around open data from its own and external sources to promote understanding of food security issues.

children.name: UN FAOSTAT
children.desc: The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization provides free access to food and agriculture data for over 245 countries and territories and covers all FAO regional groupings from 1961 to the most recent year available.

children.name: World Food Program
children.desc: Targeted interventions are needed to help to improve the lives of the poorest people - people who, either permanently or during crisis periods, are unable to produce enough food...

children.name: biosharing.org
children.desc: A curated, informative and educational resource on inter-related data standards, databases, and policies in the life, environmental and biomedical sciences

children.name: IGSR: The International Genome Sample Resource
children.desc: The 1000 Genomes Project ran between 2008 and 2015, creating the largest public catalogue of human variation and genotype data. As the project ended, the Data Coordination Centre at EMBL-EBI has received continued funding from the Wellcome Trust to maintain and expand the resource.

children.name: Child Trends
children.desc: Child Trends is the nation’s leading nonprofit research organization focused exclusively on improving the lives and prospects of children, youth, and their families.

children.name: Kids Count
children.desc: KIDS COUNT is a project of the Annie E. Casey Foundation to track the well-being of children in the United States.

children.name: Correlates of War
children.desc: COW seeks to facilitate the collection, dissemination, and use of accurate and reliable quantitative data in international relations. Key principles of the project include a commitment to standard scientific principles of replication, data reliability, documentation, review, and the transparency of data collection procedures.

children.name: Economic Freedom Institute
children.desc: Measuring peace at the global and national level allows us to assess the social, political and economic factors that create peace.  Additional measures are political risk

children.name: Global Conflict Tracker
children.desc: The Council on Foreign Relations is an independent, nonpartisan membership organization, think tank, and publisher.

children.name: Global Terrorism database
children.desc: The Global Terrorism Database (GTD) is an open-source database including information on terrorist events around the world from 1970 through 2015 (with annual updates planned for the future).

children.name: Institue for the Study of War
children.desc: The Institute for the Study of War advances an informed understanding of military affairs through reliable research, trusted analysis, and innovative education.

children.name: SIPRI databases
children.desc: SIPRI is an independent international institute dedicated to research into conflict, armaments, arms control and disarmament. Established in 1966, SIPRI provides data, analysis and recommendations, based on open sources.

children.name: Fatal Force
children.desc: 955 people have been shot and killed by police in 2016. This database is based on news reports, public records, social media and other sources. Read about our methodology. Download the data. See the 2016 database.

children.name: Crime Mapping
children.desc: CrimeMapping.com has been developed by TriTech Software Systems to help law enforcement agencies throughout North America provide the public with valuable information about recent crime activity in their neighborhood. Our goal is to assist police departments in reducing crime through a better-informed citizenry.

children.name: Southern Poverty Law Center
children.desc: We monitor hate groups and other extremists throughout the United States and expose their activities to the public, the media and law enforcement.  They provide a Hate Map and other graphics.

children.name: Hall of Justice
children.desc: Hall of Justice, a project of the Sunlight Foundation, is a robust, searchable inventory of publicly available criminal justice datasets and research.  While not comprehensive, Hall of Justice contains nearly 10,000 datasets on topics like corrections, recidivism, guns, police encounters, etc.

children.name: Sourcebook of US Criminal Justice Statistics
children.desc: Comprehensive source of data, includes public opinion polls.

children.name: The Earth Institute
children.desc: The Earth Institute’s scientists seek answers to questions about the fundamentals of the earth’s systems and the life they sustain: climate and geology, oceans and atmosphere, food, water, public health, energy, hazards, and ecosystems.

children.name: Global Surface Water Explorer
children.desc: The European Commission's Joint Research Centre developed this new water dataset in the framework of the Copernicus Programme. This maps the location and temporal distribution of water surfaces at the global scale over the past 32 years and provides statistics on the extent and change of those water surfaces.

children.name: IRI/LDEO Climate Data Library
children.desc: The IRI Data Library is a powerful and freely accessible online data repository and analysis tool that allows a user to view, analyze, and download hundreds of terabytes of climate-related data through a standard web browser.

children.name: International Disasters Database
children.desc: EM-DAT is a global database on natural and technological disasters, containing essential core data on the occurrence and effects of more than 21,000 disasters in the world, from 1900 to present.

children.name: World Resources Institue
children.desc: Natural resources are at the foundation of economic opportunity and human well-being. But today, we are depleting Earth’s resources at rates that are not sustainable, endangering economies and people’s lives.

children.name: CEPR Data Bytes
children.desc: The Center for Economic and Policy Research (CEPR) was established in 1999 to promote democratic debate on the most important economic and social issues that affect people's lives. In order for citizens to effectively exercise their voices in a democracy, they should be informed about the problems and choices that they face.

children.name: Economic Freedom - the Heritage Foundation
children.desc: Today, we live in the most prosperous time in human history. Poverty, sicknesses, and ignorance are receding throughout the world, due in large part to the advance of economic freedom. I

children.name: Economic Freedom - the Fraser Institute
children.desc: Our annual report, Economic Freedom of the World, uses 42 distinct pieces of data to measure economic freedom in 157 nations.  This site also links to The Economic Freedom of the World index data.

children.name: Global Edge
children.desc: Michigan State University tool to help companies compare Emerging Markets across several dimensions.  Requires creation of free account.

children.name: Kilts Center - Marketing Databases
children.desc: The Kilts Center at the University of Chicago makes two datasets, Neilsen's television viewing and sales store data available at no charge for academic research.

children.name: Industry Statistics Portal
children.desc: Census Bureau application that searches across programs that provide economic data for a user-selected industry. To choose the industry you are interested in use the NAICS code or keyword.

children.name: Financial Tracking Service
children.desc: FTS is managed by the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA).  It is a centralized source of curated, continuously updated, fully downloadable data and information on humanitarian funding flows.

children.name: FRED
children.desc: The Research Division of the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis is responsible for advising the Bank president on matters of economic policy. The Division monitors the economic and financial literature and produces research in the areas of money and banking, macroeconomics, and international and regional economics.

children.name: geoFRED
children.desc: GeoFRED® allows you to create, customize, and share geographical maps of data found in FRED®. Easily access the details and adjust how the data are displayed. You can also transform the data and download it according to geographic category and time frame.

children.name: World Bank
children.desc: The World Bank's Open Data initiative is intended to provide all users with access to World Bank data. The data catalog is a listing of available World Bank datasets, including databases, pre-formatted tables, reports, and other resources.

children.name: OECD data
children.desc: The OECD provides a forum in which governments can work together to share experiences and seek solutions to common problems. We work with governments to understand what drives economic, social and environmental change. We measure productivity and global flows of trade and investment. We analyse and compare data to predict future trends. We set international standards on a wide range of things, from agriculture and tax to the safety of chemicals.

children.name: International Monetary Fund
children.desc: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is an organization of 189 countries, working to foster global monetary cooperation, secure financial stability, facilitate international trade, promote high employment and sustainable economic growth, and reduce poverty around the world.

children.name: UNCTAD
children.desc: UNCTAD produces more than 150 indicators and statistical time series essential for the analysis of: International trade, economic trends, foreign direct investment, external financial resources, population and labor force, commodities, information economy, creative economy and maritime transport.

children.name: Real Estate Existing Home Sales by State (NAR)
children.desc: This information is typically raw counts of sales from local multiple listing services (MLSs) though availability and format of the data varies.  A list of state data providers, which includes association and non-association providers, is given as a courtesy reference.

children.name: National Association of Realtors Data & Statistics
children.desc: NAR's annual survey of recent home buyers and sellers provides insight into what people are buying and selling and why.

children.name: Tax Foundation
children.desc: Our Tax Data section is designed to provide quick and easy access to a wide range of data on tax rates, collections and overall tax burdens.

children.name: Non-profit Explorer
children.desc: Use this database to search over 1.8 million tax returns from tax-exempt organizations and see financial details such as their executive compensation and revenue and expenses. You can browse raw IRS data released since 2013 and access over 8.3 million tax filing documents going back as far as 2001.

children.name: Measuring Worth
children.desc: Measuring Worth is a service for calculating relative worth over time.  There are two missions: 1) make available to the public the highest quality and most reliable historical data on important economic aggregates 2) to provide carefully designed comparators (using these data) that explain the many issues involved in making value comparisons over time.

children.name: State of Working America
children.desc: The Data Library provides researchers, media, and the public with easily accessible, up-to-date, and comprehensive historical data on the American labor force. It is compiled from Economic Policy Institute analysis of government data sources.

children.name: World Wealth & Income Database
children.desc: The source for global wealth inequality data.  The key novelty has been to combine fiscal, survey and national accounts data in a systematic manner. This allowed us to compute longer and more reliable top income shares series than previous inequality databases (which generally rely on self-reported survey data, with large under-reporting problems at the top, and limited time span). These series had a large impact on the global inequality debate.

children.name: Penn World Tables
children.desc: Penn World Tables version 9.0 is a database with information on relative levels of income, output, input and productivity, covering 182 countries between 1950 and 2014.

children.name: Academy Data Forum
children.desc: The Data Forum provides a neutral space for Academy Fellows, guest writers, and staff to discuss the data that informs all of the Academy's program areas: the Humanities, Arts, and Education; Science, Engineering and Technology; Global Security and International Affairs; and American Institutions and the Public Good.

children.name: Humanities Indicator
children.desc: Using Data to Make a Strong Case for the Humanities.

children.name: GRID
children.desc: Global Research Identifier Database. Cataloging the world's research organisations.

children.name: Stanford Education Data Archive
children.desc: he Stanford Center for Education Policy Analysis unites an interdisciplinary array of nationally prominent scholars from across the campus to provide the depth and scale of research needed to affect education practice and policy in meaningful ways.

children.name: International Energy Statistics
children.desc: The IEA was founded in 1974 to help countries co-ordinate a collective response to major disruptions in the supply of oil. While this remains a key aspect of its work, the IEA has evolved and expanded. It is at the heart of global dialogue on energy, providing authoritative statistics and analysis.

children.name: Wind Europe
children.desc: compare data across school districts

children.name: Congressional Tax Reform Tracker
children.desc: It has been more than 30 years since the last major overhaul of the U.S. federal tax code and many lawmakers are getting restless. Use this tool to compare proposals.

children.name: Ibrahim Index of African Governance
children.desc: The IIAG provides an annual assessment of the quality of governance in every African country.

children.name: Open Secrets
children.desc: Nonpartisan, independent and nonprofit, the Center for Responsive Politics is the nations premier research group tracking money in U.S. politics and its effect on elections and public policy and our mission is to use that knowledge to strengthen our democracy.

children.name: Project on Government Oversight
children.desc: (POGO) is a nonpartisan independent watchdog that champions good government reforms. POGO’s investigations into corruption, misconduct, and conflicts of interest achieve a more effective, accountable, open, and ethical federal government.

children.name: US Politics and Policy
children.desc: Pew Research Center is a nonpartisan fact tank that informs the public about the issues, attitudes and trends shaping America and the world. We conduct public opinion polling, demographic research, content analysis and other data-driven social science research. We do not take policy positions.

children.name: Milliman Medical Index
children.desc: Milliman Medical Index is an actuarial analysis of the projected total cost of healthcare for a hypothetical family of four covered by an employer-sponsored preferred provider organization (PPO) plan.

children.name: AIDSinfo Online database
children.desc: This database contains country-reported GARPR data and Spectrum estimates (unrounded version for graphing purposes). For official figures, please visit http://aidsinfo.unaids.org.

children.name: The Institute for Health Metrics and Evaluation
children.desc: The IHME is an independent global health research center at the University of Washington that provides rigorous and comparable measurement of the world's most important health problems and evaluates the strategies used to address them.

children.name: State Health Facts - Kaiser Foundation
children.desc: The Hery J. Kaiser Foundation has a range of data pertaining to health care policy, women, minorities, the ACA, medicare and medicaid.  They also provide a news service and conduct public opinion polls.

children.name: WHO Global Health Observatory
children.desc: The portal features the latest data on access to health services globally and in each of WHO’s 194 Member States, along with information about equity of access. Next year WHO will add data on the impact that paying for health services has on household finances.

children.name: The CommonWealth Fund
children.desc: The Commonwealth Fund is a private foundation that aims to promote a high performing health care system that achieves better access, improved quality, and greater efficiency, particularly for society's most vulnerable.

children.name: Dental Plans Dataset
children.desc: This Dental Plans Dataset tracks a number of issues concerning dental plans sold on the marketplaces and access to dental care for underserved populations for every U.S. state.

children.name: ProPublica - Medicare Prescriptions
children.desc: Journalism in the public interest: Medicare’s popular prescription-drug program serves 41 million people and pays for more than one of every four prescriptions written nationwide. Use this tool to find and compare doctors and other providers in Part D in 2014.

children.name: HIX Compare 2015-2017 Datasets
children.desc: This unique dataset compares information on premiums, deductibles and out-of-pocket maximums, as well as cost-sharing requirements for primary care and specialist visits, prescription drugs, emergency room services and inpatient and outpatient visits for all plans across all 50 states.

children.name: Reform by the Numbers
children.desc: The Robert Wood Johnson Foundation is taking a close look at The Affordable Care Act.  They also have a data archive hosted at ICPSR.

children.name: EH.Net Databases in Economic History
children.desc: EH.Net provides an on-line location for researchers in economic history to make their data series available to other professionals and interested scholars. Several data series have been given to EH.Net and are available as downloadable files, while many other titles may be accessed through our Database Directory.

children.name: Afro-Louisiana History and Genealogy
children.desc: datasets are available to download. Example searches include:  African Names-A listing of slaves with African names. Revolts-Slaves involved in a conspiracy or a revolt against slavery. Runaways-Slave involved with reports of runaways, interrogation of captured runaways, and testimony by slaves about runaways.

children.name: Medieval and Early Modern Data Bank
children.desc: The Medieval and Early Modern Data Bank is a project established to provide scholars with an expanding library of information in electronic format on the medieval and early modern periods of European history, circa 800-1815 C.E.

children.name: Digital Humanities Institue- University of Sheffield
children.desc: one of the UK's leading Digital Humanities teams, providing research and development services for the arts, humanities and heritage domains.

children.name: London Lives
children.desc: London Lives makes available, in a fully digitised and searchable form, a wide range of primary sources about eighteenth-century London, with a particular focus on plebeian Londoners. This resource is supplemented by fifteen datasets created by other projects.

children.name: World Historical Dataverse
children.desc: Datasets available here were submitted by contributors, retrieved by CHIA staff, or created by linkage of existing datasets. They have been documented systematically according to the CHIA Level 1 standard of documentation.

children.name: African American Migrations
children.desc: In Motion: The African-American Migration Experience presents a new interpretation of African-American history, one that focuses on the self-motivated activities of peoples of African descent to remake themselves and their worlds.

children.name: Broadband Portal (OECD)
children.desc: The OECD broadband portal provides access to a range of broadband-related statistics gathered by the OECD.  Policy makers must examine a range of indicators which reflect the status of individual broadband markets.

children.name: CAIDA Centre for Applied Internet Data Analysis
children.desc: CAIDA curates datasets resulting from both active and passive measurement of the Internet. We provide access to these datasets for researchers in accordance with University of California, San Diego policy.

children.name: Child Language Data Exchange System
children.desc: CHILDES is the child language component of the TalkBank system. TalkBank is a system for sharing and studying conversational interactions.

children.name: Computing Research Association
children.desc: Explore national survey data collected from thousands of computing students annually via the Data Buddies Project.  CERP conducts large scale survey research focusing on patterns of entry and persistence in computing research at the post-secondary level.

children.name: Global Stats Counter
children.desc: Internet usage, browsers, operating systems, mobile devices, screen resolutions, etc.

children.name: Internet, Science and Tech (Pew)
children.desc: The Pew Research Center's Internet Project is pleased to offer scholars access to raw data sets from our research. All uses of this data should reference the Pew Research Center as the source of the data and acknowledge that the Pew Research bears no responsibility for interpretations presented or conclusions reached based on analysis of the data.

children.name: ITC Development Index
children.desc: ITU collects ICT statistics for 200 economies and over 100 indicators. Access a large amount of free ICT statistics, including on broadband, Internet use, mobile-cellular and mobile-broadband networks

children.name: Twitter Streams
children.desc: The Twitter Platform connects your website or application with the worldwide conversation happening on Twitter.

children.name: AARP data explorer
children.desc: Founded in 1985, PPI publishes policy analyses and provides updates on a range of topics, including current AARP priorities and emerging issues that will affect older adults in the future.

children.name: Human Development Report
children.desc: In 1990 the first Human Development Report introduced a new approach for advancing human wellbeing. Human development – or the human development approach - is about expanding the richness of human life, rather than simply the richness of the economy in which human beings live. It is an approach that is focused on people and their opportunities and choices.

children.name: IPUMS MPC
children.desc: The Integrated Public Use Microdata Series (IPUMS-USA) consists of more than fifty high-precision samples of the American population drawn from fifteen federal censuses and from the American Community Surveys of 2000-present.  IPUMS is not a collection of compiled statistics; it is composed of microdata. Each record is a person, with all characteristics numerically coded. In most samples persons are organized into households, making it possible to study the characteristics of people in the context of their families or other co-residents.  Because the data are individuals and not tables, researchers must use a statistical package to analyze the millions of records in the database. A data extraction system enables users to select only the samples and variables they require.

children.name: UN Population Division
children.desc: This interactive data query offers data for selected variables from the medium variant of World Population Prospects: The 2015 Revision.

children.name: UNICEF: the Situation of Children and Women
children.desc: UNICEF supports countries in collecting data related to children and women through Multiple Indicator Cluster Surveys (MICS), an international household survey programme. Since its inception in the mid-1990s, five rounds of MICS have been completed (in 1995-1996, 2000-2001, 2005-2006, 2009-2012, 2013-2015) and a sixth is now under way (2016-2018).

children.name: World Population Prospects
children.desc: The 2015 Revision of World Population Prospects is the twenty-fourth round of official United Nations population estimates and projections that The 2015 Revision of World Population Prospects is the twenty-fourth round of official United Nations population estimates and projections that have been prepared by the Population Division of the Department of Economic and Social Affairs of the United Nations Secretariat. The main results are presented in a series of Excel files displaying key demographic indicators for each development group, income group, major area, region and country for selected periods or dates within 1950-2100 of key demographic indicators for each development group, income group, major area, region and country for selected periods or dates within 1950-2100.

children.name: UNHCR The UN Refugee Agency
children.desc: UNHCR's populations of concern: asylum seekers, refugees, stateless persons from the year 1951 up to 2015 and more current monthly data in some categories.

children.name: The UN Refugee Agency
children.desc: The database currently contains data about UNHCR's populations of concern from the year 1951 up to 2014 and you can use it to investigate different aspects of these populations: their general composition by location of residence or origin, their status (refugees, asylum seekers, internally displaced persons, etc.), their evolution over time, and so on..

children.name: Annenberg Center
children.desc: By conducting and releasing research, staging conferences and hosting policy discussions, its scholars have addressed the role of communication in politics, adolescent behavior, child development, health care, civics and mental health, among other important arenas.

children.name: Non-profit Explorer
children.desc: Use this database to search over 1.8 million tax returns from tax-exempt organizations and see financial details such as their executive compensation and revenue and expenses. You can browse raw IRS data released since 2013 and access over 8.3 million tax filing documents going back as far as 2001.

children.name: Pew Research Center
children.desc: Pew Research Center is a nonpartisan fact tank that informs the public about the issues, attitudes and trends shaping America and the world.

children.name: Online Psychology Laboratory
children.desc: OPL represents the first National Science Foundation funded entry for psychology in the National Science Digital Library. The APA Education Directorate also provides support for this project. OPL currently offers classic studies in psychology that students can participate in, and then analyze data from the experiences.

children.name: Personality Tests - raw data
children.desc: All data is anonymous. Users were informed at the beginning of the test that there answers would be used for research and were asked to confirm that their answers were accurate and suitable for research upon completion (those that did not have been removed from these datasets).

children.name: Gender and Land Rights Database
children.desc: The Gender and Land Rights database highlights the major political, legal and cultural factors that influence the realisation of women's land rights throughout the world.  It also serves as a platform to address, discuss and provide information about gender and land issues.

children.name: Family Planning Centers
children.desc: An Industry Snapshot from the Census Bureau covering 2008-2013.  It includes locations, payroll, revenue, pop. served, etc.

children.name: LGBT Stats - Williams Institute
children.desc: The Williams Institute (UCLA School of Law) is dedicated to conducting rigorous, independent research on sexual orientation and gender identity law and public policy. The Institute does not appear to gather its own data, rather it uses publicly avaiable sources for policy research.

children.name: Social Justice Sexuality
children.desc: The Social Justice Sexuality Project is one of the largest ever national surveys of Black, Latina/o, and Asian and Pacific Islander, and multiracial lesbian, gay, bisexual, and transgender (LGBT) people.

children.name: Guttmacher Institute
children.desc: The Guttmacher Institute is a primary source of research and policy analysis on abortion, contraception, HIV and STIs, pregnancy and teens in the United States and internationally.

children.name: CDC - Sexual Health
children.desc: an array of datasets related to sexual health, risk, behavior, etc.

children.name: Bike share data tools and visualizations
children.desc: This is a listing of Bike Share data portals. It should list the city, link to the data system and outline the data currently provided.  There are also some data visualization options.

children.name: London Transport Unified API
children.desc: See what tube trains are running late.  The London Underground prefers that you register for their API. Data includes accidents, bike points, taxis, air quality, etc.  You can test it out here.
